channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2023101254
item.description:
Report X-2023101254

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-25
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking on van line, placed in tote, and bought to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: Inadequate inner package, leaking cap DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a tote and taken to QA

item.title: Report X-2023100300
item.description:
Report X-2023100300

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS LOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS WET ON THE SIDE AND REPORTED IT TO THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE PROBLEM. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA WITH A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZBAG AND FOLD ABSORB. UPON ARRIVAL, THEY NOTICED THE HAZMAT WAS WET ON THE SIDE AND PLACED IT IN THE TOTE. DescribePack: THE CAP WAS DISCOVERED LOOSE AND LEAKED OUT THRU THE SEAL UNDER THE COVER. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG.

item.title: Report X-2023100286
item.description:
Report X-2023100286

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was discovered in a load trailer with an internal leakage and brought to the QA cage for processing. DescribePack: The pkg was leaking probably due to being dropped by an unloader as 3 containers were cracked in the body. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The pkg was put in a lined salvage drum and put in the hazmat cage.

DescribePack: A little whole in the side of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA brought it to the hazmat cage for processing and placed in a lined salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023100388
item.description:
Report X-2023100388

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-29
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOAD SUPERVISOR CALLED IN LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE FOR APPRIATE CLEAN UP PROCEDURE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED CLEAN UP PROCEDURE AND BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. LEAKER WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OF BY RESPONDER.

item.title: Report X-2023100077
item.description:
Report X-2023100077

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND WET SITTING BY A SUPERVISOR DESK ON OUTBOUND AREA. RESPONDER OPENED OUTER CARTON TO DISCOVER 5 GALLON BUCKET HAD LEAKED SMALL AMOUNT DUE TO VENTED CAP ALLOWING LIQUID TO FLOW OUT. PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO DAMAGE PROCESSING ARE IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023091114
item.description:
Report X-2023091114

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-24
  • City: EDGERTON
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE LEAKING PACKAGE CALL WEARING ALL PPE (INNER GLOVES, OUTER GLOVES, SILVER SHIELDS, SLEEVES, APRON, BOOTS, GOGGLES) AND PER THE DECISION TREE RESPONDER USED PAGE 8, TESTED THE LIQUID AT 0 (RED) AND ADDED BICARBONATE UNTIL TESTED 7. RESPONDER REMOVED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND ALL SPILL DEBRIS TO THE CAGE AND FOLLOWED THE WASTE DISPOSAL CHART.

Report X-2023090835

item.title: Report X-2023090808
item.description:
Report X-2023090808

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-04T06:23:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-18
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A BOX WITH SHIPPING PAPERS AND A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL WAS LEAKING FROM A CORNER OF THE BOX IN AN UNLOAD TRAILER. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER FOUND ONE OF THE BOTTLES INSIDE THE BOX LEAKIND FROM CAP. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX AND ALL OTHER RELATED MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED IT TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023090780
item.description:
Report X-2023090780

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-04T06:23:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE UNLOAD WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND PLACED ALL MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARIVAL RESPONDER NOTED THE ONE 1 GALLON BOTTLE CAP WAS OFF THE BOTTLE. THE LEAKING BOTTLE LEAKED ON THE OTHER THREE BOTTLES. ALL MATERIAL WAS DISPOSED OF THOUGH DMP.
